Comments_List: The course offered an introduction to the francophone African novel, providing a useful theoretical and historical framework for thinking through this genre in terms of its aesthetics and politics.
This was a class that helped me to increase my base line knowledge of French literature.

I felt the course was well organized while still being supple enough to respond to the research interests of students. The course also allowed students to direct or 'teach' at least one seminar during the semester, which was a valuable learning exercise. Professor Miller provided helpful feedback throughout.
The class was well organized and I enjoyed the responsibility for preparing a session.
Yes. I would even argue that the course is indespensable for students of French and Francophone literature.
Yes. This course gives a basic sampling of French African novels, which are an important element of Francophone studies.
